thread.title: Star Wars Force Arena offers MOBA and card-style gameplay on Android
thread.title_full: Star Wars Force Arena offers MOBA and card-style gameplay on Android

author: John Callaham
title: Star Wars Force Arena offers MOBA and card-style gameplay on Android
text:
Star Wars fans have a bunch of mobile games already available to download and play from the Google Play Store. Today, yet another game from the massive sci-fi franchise makes its worldwide debut. Star Wars Force Arena, from publisher NetMarble, is a free-to-play MOBA style game, with some collectible card elements, where you pick your hero from either the Rebel Alliance or the Galactic Empire.
See also: Best Android multiplayer games 2 days ago 
Once you pick your hero character, the game makes you collect your character cards so you can then form your own squad, and those characters can be upgraded as you progress in battles. Force Arena supports 1v1 or 2v2 online multiplayer games, with a special emphasis on combining powerful pairs of characters, such as Han Solo and Chewbacca.
Competing and winning battles helps unlock special rewards and bonus items, along with even more character unlocks. The gameplay itself is based in tactical real-time strategy, at least according to the gameplay footage thatâ€™s available. The characters themselves come from a wide variety of Star Wars films, including the most recent movie Rogue One: A Star Wars Story.
Keep in mind that Star Wars Force Arena, while free to play and download, does support the use of in-game purchases. Let us know what you think of the game in the comments.
Get it at Google Play
